metadata.Title: CVE-2022-45403 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Service Workers should not be able to infer information about opaque cross-origin responses; but timing information for cross-origin media combined with Range requests might have allowed them to determine the presence or length of a media file. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 102.5, Thunderbird < 102.5, and Firefox < 107.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-45403` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs91 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
